page.description: Lists components with duplicate GUIDs in the workspace. GUID duplication can occur if you duplicate an existing component in the workspace outside the Alpha Anywhere IDE.

discussion.p: Each component has a unique GUID. This GUID is assigned when a new component is created. The GUID is used to keep track of the component's backups. If you create a copy of a component in project using Windows Explorer or other external tool, the new component may have the same GUID as another.

The *[ui:Find components with duplicate GUIDs]* will search the project for components with duplicate GUIDs. If any components are found with duplicate GUIDs, you will need to assign a new GUID to one of the components.

tip.p: To prevent duplicate GUIDs, only duplicate components using Alpha Anywhere's *[ui:Duplicate]* tool, which can be found by right-clicking a component on the Web Projects Control Panel.

description.p: On the *[ui:Web Projects Control Panel]* for the active Project, select *[ui:Edit]* > *[ui:Bulk Operation]* > *[ui:Find components with duplicate GUIDs]*.

figure.title: Locating the Find components with duplicate GUIDs tool
figure.alt: Locating the Find components with duplicate GUIDs tool

description.p: If duplicate GUIDs are found, the *[ui:Duplicate Guids]* dialog will be shown.
Select a component with a duplicate GUID, then click *[ui:Change]* and confirm changing the GUID.
Repeat until all components have unique GUIDs.
